Let's randomly select an employee from the list. The probability of selecting a particular employee is 1/20. So, the probability of not selecting that employee is 19/20.

We can repeat this process 19 times to select 19 employees. The probability of not selecting a particular employee in each iteration is 19/20. Therefore, the probability of not selecting that employee in all 19 iterations is (19/20)^19.

The probability of selecting a particular employee in at least one of the 19 iterations is 1 - (19/20)^19.
